theText: 86 1,275,200 Mr Keating-The answer to the honourable(I) The main objective of the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) is to encourage the flow of commercial investment for productive purposes, mainly from developed countries to developing member countries of the World Bank, by guaranteeing investments against non-commercial risk; e.g. currency transfer risks, expropriation, war and civil disturbance and breach of contract by the host government. (2) Australia is still considering whether to join the Agency, pending clarification of MIGA's actual operations, including its relationship with national agencies such as AUSTRADE/EFIC. MIGA is expected to come into operation shortly. The initial estimated cost of membership to Australia would be about $A5 million.
